column1:
0931|9:31 A.M.|Tuesday 9:31 A.M.
When Michael Vance walked into the third-floor trading room of Kenji Nogami's Westminster Union Bank, it had just opened for morning business. Computer screens were scrolling green numbers
column2: traders in shirtsleeves were making their first calls to Paris and Zurich
column3: the pounds and dollars and deutsche marks and yen were starting to flow.
